rows.name: Selecting a Number

block1_text.eng:
* Day of the Month
* Day of the School Year
* Roll a die, pull a slip of numbered paper from a jar, or some other way to create a random number in a range.
* perhaps the ones column of the day of the month

rows.block1_text:
* Day of the Month
* Day of the School Year
* Roll a die, pull a slip of numbered paper from a jar, or some other way to create a random number in a range.
* perhaps the ones column of the day of the month

rows.name: Use Quantities

block1_text.eng: For young students, start out by using only quantities of objects. if the quantity is 5, show 5 things. How can we make 5 things. We can have 2 things and then 3 more things, and so on. Do it all with quantities. Two rows of two and one more.

rows.block1_text: For young students, start out by using only quantities of objects. if the quantity is 5, show 5 things. How can we make 5 things. We can have 2 things and then 3 more things, and so on. Do it all with quantities. Two rows of two and one more.

rows.name: Ideas

block1_text.eng:
* restrict to just addition or subtraction
* restrict to at least 3 numbers being added
* write number in different forms - numerals, words, expanded form
* is it odd or even
* use ten frames or bundles of ten for place value
* what is one more or one less, two more or two less
* use number path, number line, 100 chart, calendar
* have students construct a number line with the number somewhere on it
* combinations of 10
